page.description: Fires when a value in the List is set.

discussion.p: The *[js:onSelect]* event is triggered when the List's value is set. This includes when a user clicks on a row in the List.
OnSelect is a superset of onClick because it fires when a value is set by clicking on a row, or using a method of the List to set the List value, or through keyboard navigation.
In addition the Javascript can reference the 'this' scope, a pointer to the List object.

important.p: If the List does not allow NULL selections, then this event will fire when the List is being initially rendered and not all properties of the List are available.
